ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was the first sociology class I have taken that offered a full understanding of how sociological theories apply to modern society, without excessive discussion of their interpretation. All sociology majors should take this course!
I was able to work on creating a more focused critical lenses when approaching social issues

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Professor Erikson! Discussions, assignments, and topics/readings were ordered in a way that each discussion easily built upon the previous!
Weaknesses: None!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, Erikson is a gem in the sociology department
Yes!! The best seminar I have taken at Yale.
I would recommend this course to another student, especially if they want to work on argumentative and persuasive writing
